homepage.beginner_improv_description: Learn the fundamentals of improvisation in a fun and supportive environment. No experience necessary! Focuses on agreement, listening, and basic scene work.
homepage.advanced_improv_description: Take your improv skills to the next level with advanced techniques and scene work. Focuses on emotional depth, advanced character work, and long-form structures. Prerequisite: Beginner Improv or equivalent.
homepage.newsletter_signup_description: Stay updated with our latest news and events!

faq_page.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq_page.what_is_improv_a: Improvisation, often called improv, is a form of live theatre in which the plot, characters, and dialogue of a game, scene, or story are made up in the moment. It's spontaneous, collaborative, and a lot of fun!
faq_page.do_i_need_experience_q: Do I need experience to join a beginner class?
faq_page.do_i_need_experience_a: Absolutely not! Our beginner classes are designed for complete novices. All you need is an open mind and a willingness to play.
faq_page.how_to_sign_up_q: How do I sign up for a course or jam?
faq_page.how_to_sign_up_a: You can sign up directly from the homepage schedule or the Courses page. Simply select your desired offering and proceed with the registration form.
faq_page.payment_methods_q: What payment methods do you accept?
faq_page.payment_methods_a: Currently, we process payments via LiqPay. More options may be added in the future.
faq_page.online_in_person_a: We offer both online and in-person classes, jams, and workshops. Please check the event details for location information.

about_page.title: About Us
about_page.our_story_text: Founded with a passion for spontaneous creativity and critical thinking, the Improv & Debate Club aims to foster a vibrant community where individuals can explore the art of improvisation and hone their debate skills. We believe in the power of collaborative storytelling and reasoned argumentation to build confidence, enhance communication, and inspire personal growth.
